channel.title: CVE Feed for simpleledger -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for simpleledger -- all products

item.title: CVE-2020-11071|2024-08-04T11:21:14.616Z -- simpleledger -- slpjs
item.description: SLPJS (npm package slpjs) before version 0.27.2, has a vulnerability where users could experience false-negative validation outcomes for MINT transaction operations. A poorly implemented SLP wallet could allow spending of the affected tokens which would result in the destruction of a user's minting baton. This is fixed in version 0.27.2.

item.title: CVE-2020-11014|2024-08-04T11:21:14.319Z -- simpleledger -- electron-cash-slp
item.description: Electron-Cash-SLP before version 3.6.2 has a vulnerability. All token creators that use the "Mint Tool" feature of the Electron Cash SLP Edition are at risk of sending the minting authority baton to the wrong SLP address. Sending the mint baton to the wrong address will give another party the ability to issue new tokens or permanently destroy future minting capability. This is fixed version 3.6.2.

item.title: CVE-2020-15131|2024-08-04T13:08:22.279Z -- simpleledger -- slp-validate.js
item.description: In SLP Validate (npm package slp-validate) before version 1.2.2, there is a vulnerability to false-positive validation outcomes for the NFT1 Child Genesis transaction type. A poorly implemented SLP wallet or opportunistic attacker could create a seemingly valid NFT1 child token without burning any of the NFT1 Group token type as is required by the NFT1 specification. This is fixed in version 1.2.2.

item.title: CVE-2020-11072|2024-08-04T11:21:14.682Z -- simpleledger -- slp-validate
item.description: In SLP Validate (npm package slp-validate) before version 1.2.1, users could experience false-negative validation outcomes for MINT transaction operations. A poorly implemented SLP wallet could allow spending of the affected tokens which would result in the destruction of a user's minting baton. This has been fixed in slp-validate in version 1.2.1. Additonally, slpjs version 0.27.2 has a related fix under related CVE-2020-11071.

item.title: CVE-2020-15130|2024-08-04T13:08:22.292Z -- simpleledger -- slpjs
item.description: In SLPJS (npm package slpjs) before version 0.27.4, there is a vulnerability to false-positive validation outcomes for the NFT1 Child Genesis transaction type. A poorly implemented SLP wallet or opportunistic attacker could create a seemingly valid NFT1 child token without burning any of the NFT1 Group token type as is required by the NFT1 specification. This is fixed in version 0.27.4.
